channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Notorious conspiracy theorist Alex Jones' assets will be sold to pay a $1.5 billion debt to families of the Sandy Hook massacre victims
item.description: The court-ordered consequence is the result of Jones' defamatory claims that the shooting, which claimed the lives of 20 children and six teachers, was a "hoax" portrayed by actors.

item.title: CEOs at Trump meeting: Ex-president ‘meandering’ and ‘doesn't know what he's talking about’
item.description: Trump offered scant details on how he would reduce taxes and cut back on business regulations, according to two people in the room.

item.title: Why the Supreme Court’s Starbucks ruling likely won’t stop workers unionizing
Hugging Face CEO says he hears from 10 AI founders a week who want to sell their startups
item.description: “This year, in particular, it has increased quite a lot,” the CEO said.

item.title: Adobe shares surge 15% for sharpest rally since 2020
item.description: Adobe reported better-than-expected earnings and revenue, lifting the stock to its biggest gain in more than four years.

item.title: French banks' bonds buckle as Paris awaits snap elections
Longevity investor Bryan Johnson hosted Kim Kardashian and Andrew Huberman at a ‘Don’t Die Dinner,' where they discussed their own mortality
item.description: What do these influencers have in common? A night of nutty pudding.

item.title: 'Inside Out 2' arrives in theaters and could hit a 100-day run. Here's why that's increasingly rare
item.description: Both Walt Disney Animation and Pixar struggled to regain a foothold at the box office after pandemic restrictions lessened and audiences returned to theaters.

item.title: Apple’s stock led the Dow this week — and could see more momentum ahead
Jensen Huang made Nvidia a $3 trillion juggernaut. But the path to success was filled with ‘despair’ and ‘torture’
item.description: At a Fortune conference in 2018, the tech CEO said “there’s no point in starting a company unless you want to make a meaningful contribution to society.”

item.title: Investors wonder if tech can keep lifting S&P 500 to records this summer as some cracks emerge
What Wells Fargo’s ‘mouse-jiggler’ scandal says about the problem with work now
FTC chair Lina Khan plans to go after Big Tech’s ‘mob boss’ instead of ‘the henchmen at the bottom’—targeting AI giants OpenAI, Microsoft, and Nvidia
item.description: “Where do we see players that are systematically driving these illegal behaviors?” Khan asked at a conference this week.

item.title: Stocks making the biggest moves midday: Adobe, RH, Hasbro and more
item.description: These are the stocks posting the largest moves in midday trading.

item.title: Dow logs longest losing streak in 2 months, S&P 500 pulls back from record highs
